title: Ariana Grande Reacts to ‘Blindsiding’ Second Golden Globes Nomination for ‘Wicked’: ‘I’m So Moved’
summary: "there are truly no words," the performer wrote of the rare feat.
body: Ariana Grande received some very, very good news on Monday morning (Dec. 8). One year after scoring her first-ever Golden Globe nod, the singer-actress once again earned a nomination for her performance as Glinda in the Wicked films following the premiere of the sequel earlier this year. Related Here Are All the Golden Globe Nominees for Best Original Song That Topped the Hot 100 for 6 or More Weeks ‘One Battle After Another,’ ‘The White Lotus’ Lead 2026 Golden Globe Award Nominations: Full List Watch Ariana Grande & Cynthia Erivo Perform ‘Get Happy’/’Happy Days’ Medley at Intimate Hollywood Event And in an interview with The Hollywood Reporter shortly after the 2026 nominations list dropped, Grande gushed that her second time being recognized in the best supporting actress category is “definitely just as exciting” as the first. “You don’t expect something like this, let alone to happen twice for the same role,” she told the publication, adding that the nod feels “kind of blindsiding.” “I’m just deeply honored,” she continued. “I’m just really moved by it.…

title: ‘One Battle After Another,’ ‘The White Lotus’ Lead 2026 Golden Globe Award Nominations: Full List
summary: Wicked: For Good is nominated for the cinematic and box office achievement award, which was won by Wicked last year.
body: One Battle After Another is the leading nominee on the film side for the 83rd annual Golden Globe Awards with nine nods, followed by Sentimental Value with eight, Sinners with seven; Hamnet with six, and Frankenstein and Wicked: For Good with five each. The White Lotus is the top nominee on the television side with six nods, followed by Adolescence with five, and Only Murders in the Building and Severance with four each. In the new best podcast category, the inaugural nominees are Armchair Expert With Dax Shepard , Call Her Daddy , Good Hang With Amy Poehler , The Mel Robbins Podcast , Smartless and Up First . The nominations were announced on Monday (Dec. 8). Cynthia Erivo and Ariana Grande were both nominated for their performances in Wicked: For Good , just as they were for the first Wicked film a year ago. Wicked: For Good is also nominated for the cinematic and box office achievement award, which was won by Wicked last year (and Barbie the year before that). The other nominees in the Globes’ most distinctive category are Avatar: Fire and Ash , F1, KPop Demon Hunters , Mission: Impossible – The Final Reckoning , Sinners , Weapons and Zootopia 2. KPop Demon Hunters is nominated…

title: Here Are All the Golden Globe Nominees for Best Original Song That Topped the Hot 100 for 6 or More Weeks
summary: Film music legend Giorgio Moroder co-wrote two of the 10 songs.
body: Hundreds of songs have received Golden Globe nominations for best original song since the award was introduced at the 19th Golden Globe ceremony in March 1962. But just 10 of them have topped the Billboard Hot 100 for six or more weeks. Two of them – Blondie ’s “Call Me” from American Gigolo and Irene Cara ’s “Flashdance…What a Feeling” from Flashdance – were co-written by Giorgio Moroder . “Flashdance” went on to win the Oscar for best original song, as did the Debby Boone smash “You Light Up My Life,” but the eight other Globe winners which topped the Hot 100 for six or more weeks did not, surprisingly. The first Globe nominee for best original song to top the Hot 100 was “Strangers in the Night” from the 1966 James Garner film A Man Could Get Killed . The song appears in the film only as an instrumental titled “Beddy Bye.” Frank Sinatra ’s producer, Jimmy Bowen, indicated that the singer might record the song if lyrics were added and the title was changed. Charles Singleton and Eddie Snyder wrote lyrics to accompany the melody by German composer Bert Kaempfert. Sinatra’s recording of “Strangers in the Night” reached No. 1 in July 1966. The second Globe nominee for best original…

title: Here’s your first look at the slick animation for Android’s NameDrop-style contact sharing feature
summary: Google is making steady progress on its NameDrop-style contact exchange feature for Android, and we have the proof.
body: Credit: AssembleDebug / Android Authority TL;DR Google is developing a NameDrop-style contact-sharing feature for Android. We can now show you the slick animation that will accompany the feature and appear when two Android phones are brought together. We still don’t know the marketing name Google plans to use for the feature, but internally, it’s referred to as “Gesture Exchange” and “Contact Exchange.” Google appears to be moving full steam ahead on its NameDrop-like contact sharing feature for Android . Thanks to a new update to Google Play Services, we were able to surface a slick animation that accompanies the feature and shows up when two Android devices are brought close together to enable the contact exchange.
